alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Dougherty; Lee; Randolph; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Dougherty, southeastern Randolph, Lee, Calhoun and Terrell Counties in southwestern Georgia through 1000 PM EDT... At 915 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Plains to near Arlington. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Morgan, Dawson, Leesburg, Albany, Arlington, Leary, Smithville, East Albany, Turner City, Walker, Sasser, Bronwood, Parrott, Chokee, Stocks, Forrester, Lockett Crossing, South Albany, Southwest Ga Regional A/P and Palmyra. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
